document.title: 2024 NCSCOS Arts Education Standards Framework
document.source: Final NCSCOS Arts Education Framework - Google Docs.pdf
document.organization: North Carolina Department of PUBLIC INSTRUCTION

strands.name: Connect
strands.description: Explore and relate artistic ideas and works to past, present, and future societies and cultures.
strands.essential_question: How do I build background knowledge to apply to my field of art?

strands.name: Create
strands.description: Create and adapt new artistic ideas and work individually or collaboratively.
strands.essential_question: How do I express original ideas through the creation of art, considering copyright and fair use laws?

strands.name: Present
strands.description: Present, perform, produce, and develop artistic ideas and works.
strands.essential_question: How do I build technique and skill to present works of art to an audience effectively?

strands.name: Respond
strands.description: Analyze and evaluate how the arts communicate.
strands.essential_question: How do I discuss, evaluate, and provide feedback on works of art?

standards.text: Relate dance ideas and works with personal, societal, cultural, historical, and daily life contexts, including diverse and marginalized groups.
Explore advancements in the field of dance.
Create original dance movements and works that communicate ideas, experiences, feelings, or images, independently and collaboratively.
Adapt original dance ideas and works, and those of peers and other artists, independently and collaboratively.
Perform dance works from a variety of styles, cultures, and genres.
Develop dance presentations.
Analyze dance from a variety of styles, cultures, and genres using content-specific vocabulary.
Evaluate dance works using content-specific vocabulary.
Relate musical ideas and works with personal, societal, cultural, historical, and daily life contexts, including diverse and marginalized groups.
Explore advancements in the field of music.
Create original musical ideas and works, independently and collaboratively.
Adapt original musical ideas and works, and those of peers and other artists, independently and collaboratively.
Perform music from a variety of styles, cultures, and genres.
Develop musical presentations.
Analyze musical works from a variety of styles, cultures, and genres using content-specific vocabulary.

variants.text: Analyze musical works from a variety of styles, cultures, and genres including response through moving, singing, playing instruments, or content-specific vocabulary.
Analyze aural and written works of music from a variety of styles, cultures, and genres using content-specific vocabulary.

standards.text: Evaluate musical works using content-specific vocabulary.
Relate theatrical ideas and works with personal, societal, cultural, historical, and daily life contexts, including diverse and marginalized groups.
Explore advancements in the field of theatre arts.
Create original theatrical ideas and works, independently and collaboratively.
Adapt original theatrical ideas and works, and those of peers and other artists, independently and collaboratively.
Perform theatrical works from a variety of styles, cultures, and genres.
Develop theatrical presentations.
Analyze theatrical works from a variety of styles, cultures, and genres using content-specific vocabulary.
Evaluate theatrical works using content-specific vocabulary.
Relate visual arts ideas and works with personal, societal, cultural, historical, and daily life contexts, including diverse and marginalized groups.
Explore advancements in the field of visual arts.

Create original visual arts ideas and 2-D and 3-D artworks, including drawing, painting, printmaking, fibers, sculpture, ceramics, and digital media, using tools safely and appropriately, independently and collaboratively.
Adapt original visual arts ideas and work, and those of peers and other artists, independently and collaboratively.
Present visual artworks.
Develop visual arts presentations.
Analyze visual artworks from a variety of styles, cultures, and genres using content-specific vocabulary.
Evaluate visual artworks using content-specific vocabulary.
